The total length of this tunnel is 53.85km.This is the world's longest and deepest underwater tunnel. This tunnel links Hokkaido with the main Japanese island of Honshu. 
# 
# 
This is Japanese foremost fire festival.The parade of massive lanterns floats and high-spirited Haneto(Nebuta dancers)is a compelling sight. 
This is a popular hot spring village boasting 9 different kinds of onsen waterand abundant hot water.Youwillfind the Hokkaido heritage site Noboribetsu Jigokudani(Hell Valley) here. You can enjoy Demons' Fire Trail at night.

NEW CHITOSEAIRPORT

# 
This is one of Japan's leading winter events. This festival is held every year in February. You can have fun seeinglarge snow/ice sculptures and various events.

# 

This castle is located in Hirosaki Parkfamous as a cherry blossom spot.The tower of the castle that was built about 200 years ago still remainstoday. 
# 
This is one of the best night views in Japan. The unique topography surroundedbythe seaonbothsides and theviewof thelights as through it is inlaid with sparkling jewelry is wondrous. 
# 
# 
This is a market with a fullrange of freshfsh,dried fsh,delicacies, souvenirs and famous products of Hachinohe.You can also taste seafood and local cuisine with an outstanding degree of freshness here. 

HIRAIZUMIO 



# 
FUKUSHIMA 
# 

This is a world heritage site consisting of five component properties, such as Chuson-ji Temple that is famous for Konjikido(Golden Hall). Thisworld heritage site isa collection of temples, gardens and archeologiCal sitesthatwerebuilt withaneye on the ideal world of Buddhism. 

# 
This church is Japan' s first Russian Orthodox Church. The contrast between thewhitewalls and the green roof is beautiful.The bells that ring with a lovely tone are so famous. 
KORIYAMA 
This is a Western-style fort characterized by itsstar shape.This siteis packed with historic explorationhighlights,including Hakodate Magistrate's Office. In spring, this is one of Hokkaido's leading cherry blossom spots, while themoat is lit up in winter. 

# 
You can get from Tokyo to Shin-Hakodate-Hokuto in as little as about 4 hours without the need for any transfers. This station is directly connected with the northern Tohoku area, and so you can also enjoy visiting Mivaqi,Iwate,Aomoriand Hakodate. 
UTSUNOMIYA 

# 
This is one of the world's leading tourist cities. You can find many kinds of foods and attractions here along with traditional culture, modern culture and shopping.

# 
# 
This is a free pass sold only to travelers from overseas visiting Japan. This pass lets you ride on the Shinkansen and limited express trains in the southern Hokkaido area (including Sapporo, Hakodate and New Chitose Airport) and the eastern Japan area (including the Tohoku region) as a joint product from JR EASTandJRHOKKAIDO. 
# 
# 
Thispassisvalid foranysixdaysinthe4-dayperiod from thedayit is ssued(Flexilesixdays) \*The day the pass is issued is the day it is exchanged (when purchased outside of Japan) or sold (when purchased in Japan). 

\begin{tabular}{lll}
SalesoutsideJapan & Adult ￥26,000 & Child ￥13,000 \\
SaleswithinJapan & Adult ￥27,000 & Child ￥13,500 \\
\end{tabular}


# 
This pass can be used for unlimited travel on reserved seats of ordinary cars on local, express and limited express(including theShinkansen) trains on the JR HOKKAIDO lines in the free area, JR EAST lines (including BRT), Izu Kyuko Line, Tokyo Monorail, Aoimori Railway, Iwate Galaxy Railway (IGR) and Sendai Airport Transit. In addition, this pass can be used for unlimited travel on reserved seats of ordinary cars on rapid trains on Tobu lines (as long as either the departing or destination station is on a JR line), such as "Nikko,”SPACIA Nikko,"Kinugawa" and"SPACIAKinuqawa." 
\*It is not possible to use this passto board the South Hokkaido Railway or Hakodate city tram. 
# 
#

Travel Service Centers(ViewPlaza):YokohamaStation,MitoStation,FukushimaStation, Sendai Station, Yamagata Station, Morioka Station, Hachinohe Station, Aomori Station, Akita Station, Shinagawa Station\*, Shibuya Station\*, Ikebukuro Station (West Exit)\* and Ueno Station\* \*Stationsmarkedwithanasteriskhandlesalesonly 
Information Centers (The following locations handle exchanges only):Shinagawa Station General Information Counter, Shibuya Station Information Center, Shinjuku Station (East Exit) Information Center, Ikebukuro Station Information Center, Ueno Station (Central Exit) General Information Counter and Sendai Airport Transit Sendai Airport Station "JR EAST PASS Exchangeoffice" 
# 
The JAPAN RAIL PASS is a pass provided jointly by the six companies comprising the Japan Railways Group (JR Group). This is a great value way to travel allover Japanby train. 
# 
# 
This pass is valid for 7, 14 or 21 consecutive days beginning on the date it is first used. \*You can choose any day as the starting date within a one month period from day on which you turn in your Exchange Orderfor the pass. 

\begin{tabular}{lllll}
Type & \multicolumn{2}{l}{GreenCar} & \multicolumn{2}{l}{Ordinary Car} \\
Duration & Adult & Child & Adult & Child \\
7 days & ￥38,880 & ￥19,440 & ￥29,110 & ￥14,550 \\
14 days & ￥62,950 & ￥31,470 & ￥46,390 & ￥23,190 \\
21 days & ￥81,870 & ￥40,930 & ￥59,350 & ￥29,670 \\
\end{tabular}

The routes that can be taken are subject tochange.) $^{*}|\mathfrak{t}$ is not possible to ride the highway bus routes of JR Bus companies. ●JR WEST Miyajima Ferry (between Miyajima and Miyajimaguchi) \*The hydrofoilferry service operated by JR KYUSHU between Hakata and Pusan (Korea) is not covered) \*It is not possible to use this pass to board the South Hokkaido Railway or Hakodate city tram. 
# 
The JAPAN RAIL PASS is sold by travel companies and agencies overseas which sell products for travelers from overseas visiting Japan (e.g.the JAPAN RAIL PASS). Please turn in your Exchange Order for a pass after arriving in Japan. You can turn in your Exchange Order at JAPAN RAIL PASS exchange locations in the main JR stations. \*You cannot purchase the JAPAN RAIL PASS in Japan. 
JAPANRAILPASSPRECAUTIONS $\circledcirc$ There may be some excluded trains and additional charges within the range of use on JR lines. $\circledcirc$ f you use a privaterailway company line, you will have to pay the fare and fee for each section you use. $\circledcirc$ Pleasecheckour website or contact the JR companies directly for other detailed information.
